intro: Panzerina lanata, commonly known as the woolly panzerina, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, woolly stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Panzerina lanata is often found in open grasslands and along the edges of shrublands, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
